page.title: 15PUBLIC HOUSES IN CLOPHILL
page.content: We are very well endowed with{Public {Houses}in{Clophill}considering the size of the population. We have{five now but there were many more in years gone by. All of them do bar meals. As we enter from the{A6}we find{The {Flying Horse.}This was once a Coaching Inn. It is now a Beefeater Steakhouse & is owned by{Whitbread Breweries. Now we come to{The Green Man.}This is much smaller & more of a village pub. It is our oldest pub & is owned by {Greene King Breweries. In half a mile we reach{The Compasses which is run by{Whitbreads. { Greene King}own{The Rising Sun}on the Shefford Road. Hidden away in Back St.is{The Stone {Jug,}it is the only{Free House}in the village. The Publican may buy his beer from any brewery.
